intro: Dicrastylis exsuccosa var. tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly star-grass, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its inflorescence consists of spike-like clusters of small white or pale blue flowers. The species is noted for its adaptability to arid conditions and its role in local ecosystems.
